page.title: 19Wool Village...Housing
page.content: Mr.Hyde,who will be 100 years old in December 1985,tells us that when he was a boy Wool was only a quarter of its present size...there being houses in Duck Street,High Street and Spring Street only;the rest was fields. Many of these houses were thatched. Although most of the thatched houses in Duck Street have been pulled down to make room for modern bungalows,much has been preserved in the other two streets. Whilst parts of the village have retained their old world charm, a great deal of modern building development has taken place. There are new Council estates and estates of private housing. Wool is fortunate in having a railway station, so the village can be "home" to commuters to Bournemouth,Southampton and London.
